00054 namespace phys

00057     {
00058         Attribute::Attribute()
00059         {
00060             this->Wrapped = new ticpp::Attribute();
00061             this->TakeOwnerOfWrapped();
00062         }
00063 
00064         Attribute::Attribute (const String &name, const String &value)
00065         {
00066             this->Wrapped = new ticpp::Attribute(name,value);
00067             this->TakeOwnerOfWrapped();
00068         }
00069 
00070         Attribute::Attribute(ticpp::Attribute* Meta, bool FirstTimeUsed)
00071         {
00072             this->Wrapped = Meta;
00073             if (FirstTimeUsed)
00074                 { this->TakeOwnerOfWrapped(); }
00075         }
00076 
00077         Attribute::Attribute (const Attribute &CopiedAttribute)
00078         {
00079             /// @todo TODO rework the phys::xml::Attribute copy constructor to actually make a new copy.
00080             this->Wrapped = CopiedAttribute.Wrapped;
00081 
00082             //alternative shared_ptr code
00083             //this->Wrapped = new BasePointer(CopiedAttribute.Wrapped);
00084         }
00085 
00086         Attribute::~Attribute()
00087             { /* Attribute have no children and phys::xml::Base will handle deleting wrapped, so we have very little to do*/}
00088 
00089         Attribute* Attribute::GetPointerFromWrapped(ticpp::Attribute* Meta)
00090         {
00091             Attribute* Other;
00092             try {
00093                 //Most likely cause of failure is ticpp::Node::GetBasePointer() returns 0
00094                 Other = static_cast<Attribute*>( Meta->GetBasePointer()->GetUserData() );
00095             } catch (ticpp::Exception e) {
00096                 std::stringstream temp;
00097                 temp << "Could not Create phys::xml::Attribute from invalid pointer." << std::endl << e.what() << std::endl << "Details: " << e.m_details;
00098                 throw Exception(temp.str());
00099             }
00100 
00101             //If there is no pointer inside TinyXML to our node, then it doesn't exist, so make it Otherwise use what is there
00102             if(0 == Other)
00103                 { Other = new Attribute(Meta, true); }
00104             return Other;
00105         }
00106 
00107         String Attribute::GetValueAsString() const
00108         {
00109             return static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (this->Wrapped)->Value();
00110             //alternative shared_ptr code
00111             //return static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> ((*(this->Wrapped)).get())->Value();
00112             // please let me explain the above line.
00113             // 1. "this->Wrapped" - This deep down is the Object we want to run a method on.
00114             // 2. "*(this->Wrapped)" - It is really a pointer so we dereference it.
00115             // 3. "(*(this->Wrapped)).get()" - After dereference this pointer we are given a boost::shared_ptr which is a reference counting pointer.
00116             //      So now we call ".get()" to return the actual pointer we need.
00117             // 4. "static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (AboveGibberish)" - Since The pointer is a base class, but we know it is pointer to a derived class
00118             //      we cast it to the appropriate class
00119             // 5. "AboveGibberish->Value()" - This is the only part that actually performs work, this calls the Value() method on the buried object
00120             // 6. return AboveGibberish; - Finally we return whatever that method we ran spat out.
00121         }
00122 
00123         Whole Attribute::GetValueAsWhole() const
00124         {
00125             Whole Temp=0;
00126             static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (this->Wrapped)->GetValue(&Temp);
00127             return Temp;
00128         }
00129 
00130         Real Attribute::GetValueAsReal() const
00131         {
00132             Real Temp=0;
00133             static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (this->Wrapped)->GetValue(&Temp);
00134             return Temp;
00135         }
00136 
00137         void Attribute::SetValue (const Whole &value)
00138             { static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (this->Wrapped)->SetValue(value); }
00139 
00140         void Attribute::SetValue (const Real &value)
00141             { static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (this->Wrapped)->SetValue(value); }
00142 
00143         void Attribute::SetValue (const String &value)
00144             { static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (this->Wrapped)->SetValue(value); }

00146         void Attribute::SetName(const String &Name)
00147             { static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (this->Wrapped)->SetName(Name);}
00148 
00149         String Attribute::GetName() const
00150             { return static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (this->Wrapped)->Name();}
00151 
00152         Attribute* Attribute::Next() const
00153             { return this->GetPointerFromWrapped(static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (this->Wrapped)->Next(true)); }
00154 
00155             //Should add exception handling to the navigation functions
00156         Attribute* Attribute::Previous() const
00157             { return this->GetPointerFromWrapped(static_cast<ticpp::Attribute*> (this->Wrapped)->Previous(true)); }

00159         Base::XMLComponentType Attribute::GetType() const
00160             { return Base::isAttribute; }
